title: Kendall Jenner, Khloe and Kim Kardashian keep it casual at Kanye West's Sunday Service in LA
text:
Kanye West released his highly-anticipated album Jesus Is King on Friday so no doubt his first Sunday Service since the release was shaping up to be the performance of the year.

And the 42-year-old rapper definitely had familial support for the inspiring concert.

Khloe Kardashian and Kendall Jenner were seen outside The Forum in Inglewood on Sunday as they attended the gala event.

Casual customers: Khloe Kardashian (left) and Kendall Jenner were seen outside The Forum in Inglewood on Sunday as they attended the gala event

Support system: Kanye's wife Kim Kardashian was also obviously there to support as she was seen happily filming the concert, as Sia was also in attendance next to momager Kris Jenner (bottom right)

Kanye's wife Kim was also obviously there to support as she was seen happily filming the concert.

It was quite the star-studded event as Sia and Kenny G were both in attendance.

The mother of four Kim, 39, looked fantastic in a long python leather coat over baggy beige trousers.

Goals: Kris was seen being dropped off in a platinum Cadillac Escalade

On the go: Kendall was later seen out and about in Los Angeles as she supported her brother-in-law by wearing a blue Jesus Is King sweatshirt

Making moves: she gave a peek at her toned tum

Khloe was in the audience, on babysitter duty watching his daughter Chicago, 1, along with her cousins Reign, 4, and Penelope, 7 (son and daughter of Khloe's sister Kourtney Kardashian).

The big crowds were in awe of the performance onstage, which welcomed guest performers Kenny G, Pusha T and even Kim Kardashian and Kanye's eldest daughter North West, who sang along with the choir.

Kanye looked in his element at the center of it all, playing the keyboard and at one point, while performing songs from his new album, reading lyrics off of his phone.

Soothing sounds: Kim, 39, was active on social media as she shared this image of Kenny chatting with Pusha T

Squad goals: Kourtney Kardashian was also in attendance as she danced with Khloe

Incognito: Kris wore her sunglasses indoors

Quite the scene: Kim shared this inspiring photo from the performance

Khloe, 35, documented the day's festivities extensively on her Instagram Stories, filming as the inspired choir danced and clapped in unison onstage, and also taking fun selfie videos of herself and the kids, with a butterfly filter added to everyone's faces.

Kardashian also filmed shots of her younger half-sister Kendall Jenner, 23, who sweetly made kissy faces for the camera.

In his element: Kanye West, who finally last week released his new gospel album Jesus Is King, held his first Sunday Service since the album dropped at the Forum in Inglewood, California

A spirited service: Kanye can be seen among his choir bathed in white on stage, with daughter North on his shoulders

Aunt Khloe: Khloe was in the audience, on babysitter duty watching his daughter Chicago along with her cousins Reign and Penelope

Aunt Kendall too: Khloe also filmed shots of her younger half-sister Kendall Jenner

Cute: Kendall sweetly made kissy faces for the camera

Proclamation: The Forum welcomed Kanye for his Sunday Service, with banners outside the venue heralding his new album

Penelope looked like she was enjoying herself immensely, riding piggyback on her aunt Khloe's back.

Chicago, who was seated in Khloe's lap, also looked positively gleeful.

The beautifully long-haired little boy Reign was seated next to his aunt, looking reflective during the service.

Crowd onstage: The inspired choir sang, danced and clapped in unison onstage, lit in different colors

Beautiful: Reign was seated next to his aunt, looking reflective during the service

Never cuter: Chicago was seated in Khloe's lap

Electric energy: The vibe inside the venue on Sunday was intense and full of spirit, with Kanye and his choir performing under a screen above that showed a cloudy blue sky

Kanye's wife Kim Kardashian was also present, adding updates to her IG story as well — including images of the performance onstage bathed in changing colored lights from white to blue, as well as an excited snap of jazz performer Kenny G, who later played his sax onstage.

West finally released his new, highly anticipated gospel rap album Jesus Is King on Friday, after several delays.

The Christian album was accompanied by a behind-the-scenes featurette released on YouTube, along with a Jesus Is King film that was released in IMAX theaters.

The numbers looked good for the short film as it brought in $1.03 million globally over the weekend, according to Variety.

According to TMZ, guests to this week's Sunday Service only had to pay $10 to attend — with the proceeds reportedly going to a charity.

Moody blue: The performance onstage was bathed in changing colored lights from white to blue

Like father like daughter: Kanye welcomed guest performers Kenny G, Pusha T and even his daughter North, who sang along with the choir
description: Khloe Kardashian and Kendall Jenner were seen outside The Forum in Inglewood on Sunday as they attended the gala event.
